curam.util.dataaccess
Class DynamicDataAccess

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.dataaccess.DynamicDataAccess

public final class DynamicDataAccess
extends java.lang.Object

DynamicDataAccess is an API which can be used to execute a SQL statement which has been created in application code.

Method Summary

Method Detail

executeNs

public static java.lang.Object executeNs(java.lang.Class<?> rsltClass,
                                         java.lang.Object key,
                                         boolean performAuditing,
                                         java.lang.String dynamicSQL)
                                  throws AppException,
                                         InformationalException
Executes a SQL statement which will have a singleton result. The SQL statement result is returned as an object, the type of which is specified as an input parameter. There is no validation of the SQL before execution. The SQL should take the same form as handcrafted SQL in the model. For example: SELECT attribute_two INTO :result FROM DynamicSQLTestEnt WHERE attribute_one =:attribute_one; The method requires the type of the return object to be defined. The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the SQL statement should also be defined, along with a boolean indicator detailing if auditing should be performed for the SQL statement, and the handcrafted SQL string. DynamicDataAccess.executeNsMulti(Class, Object, boolean, String) should be used to execute a SQL statement with multiple results.

Parameters:
rsltClass - The class of object returned by this data access.
key - The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the dynamicSQL statement. null should be passed in if a key is not to be used.
performAuditing - Whether the database updates done by this operation should be recorded on an audit trail.
dynamicSQL - A valid SQL statement to be executed against the database.
Returns:
The result of the SQL statement, the type of which is specified as an input parameter.
Throws:
AppException - If the provided dynamicSQL is invalid.
InformationalException - Generic exception signature.

executeNsMulti

public static <T> CuramValueList<T> executeNsMulti(java.lang.Class<T> dtlsClass,
                                                   java.lang.Object key,
                                                   boolean performAuditing,
                                                   java.lang.String dynamicSQL)
                                        throws AppException,
                                               InformationalException
Executes a SQL statement which will have multiple results. The SQL statement result is returned as a CuramValueList populated with the results of the dynamic data access SQL as a list of details objects, the type of which are specified as an input parameter. There is no validation of the SQL before execution. The SQL should take the same form as handcrafted SQL in the model. For example: SELECT attribute_one, attribute_two INTO :attribute_one,:attribute_two FROM DynamicSQLTestEnt WHERE attribute_one=:attribute_one; The method requires the type of the objects contained in the list to be defined. The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the SQL statement should also be defined, along with a boolean indicator detailing if auditing should be performed for the SQL statement, and the handcrafted SQL string. DynamicDataAccess.executeNs(Class, Object, boolean, String) should be used to execute a SQL statement with a singleton result.

Type Parameters:
T - Details Struct Type
Parameters:
dtlsClass - The type of the objects to be contained in the returned list.
key - The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the dynamicSQL statement. null should be passed in if a key is not to be used.
performAuditing - Whether the database updates done by this operation should be recorded on an audit trail.
dynamicSQL - A valid SQL statement to be executed against the database.
Returns:
The CuramValueList populated with the results of the dynamic data access SQL as a list of details objects, the type of which are specified as an input parameter. The list contains all the entries and not only the curam.db.readmultimax number of records. If the readmulti maximum is reached then a readmulti-max message gets logged.
Throws:
AppException - If the provided dynamicSQL is invalid.
InformationalException - Generic exception signature.

executeNsMulti

public static <T> CuramValueList<T> executeNsMulti(java.lang.Class<T> dtlsClass,
                                                   java.lang.Object key,
                                                   boolean performAuditing,
                                                   boolean requireInformational,
                                                   java.lang.String dynamicSQL)
                                        throws AppException,
                                               InformationalException
Executes a SQL statement which will have multiple results and the results is dependent on the specified boolean requireInformational value. The SQL statement result is returned as a CuramValueList populated with the results of the dynamic data access SQL as a list of details objects, the type of which are specified as an input parameter. There is no validation of the SQL before execution. The SQL should take the same form as handcrafted SQL in the model. For example: SELECT attribute_one, attribute_two INTO :attribute_one,:attribute_two FROM DynamicSQLTestEnt WHERE attribute_one=:attribute_one; The method requires the type of the objects contained in the list to be defined. The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the SQL statement should also be defined, along with boolean indicators detailing if auditing should be performed for the SQL statement and whether an informational is required if readmulti maximum is reached also the handcrafted SQL string. DynamicDataAccess.executeNs(Class, Object, boolean, String) should be used to execute a SQL statement with a singleton result.

Type Parameters:
T - Details Struct Type
Parameters:
dtlsClass - The type of the objects to be contained in the returned list.
key - The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the dynamicSQL statement. null should be passed in if a key is not to be used.
performAuditing - Whether the database updates done by this operation should be recorded on an audit trail.
requireInformational - Indicator as to whether an informational is required when the readmulti maximum is reached. If the requireInformational is set false and readmulti maximum is reached then a readmulti-max message gets logged and all entries are returned to the user. If the requireInformational is set to true and readmulti maximum is reached then an InformationalMessage can be added to the current transactions Informational-Manager, for handling in the Application's Facade layer. In this case only the specified readmulti-max number of entries will be returned to the user.
dynamicSQL - A valid SQL statement to be executed against the database.
Returns:
The CuramValueList populated with the results of the dynamic data access SQL as a list of details objects, the type of which are specified as an input parameter. The size of the list depends on the specified requireInformational indicator and the curam.db.readmultimax settings.
Throws:
AppException - If the provided dynamicSQL is invalid.
InformationalException - Generic exception signature.

executeNsMulti

public static <T> CuramValueList<T> executeNsMulti(java.lang.Class<T> dtlsClass,
                                                   java.lang.Object key,
                                                   boolean performAuditing,
                                                   boolean requireInformational,
                                                   int readMultiMax,
                                                   java.lang.String dynamicSQL)
                                        throws AppException,
                                               InformationalException
Executes a SQL statement which will have multiple results and the results is dependent on the specified boolean requireInformational and readMultiMax value. The SQL statement result is returned as a CuramValueList populated with the results of the dynamic data access SQL as a list of details objects, the type of which are specified as an input parameter. There is no validation of the SQL before execution. The SQL should take the same form as handcrafted SQL in the model. For example: SELECT attribute_one, attribute_two INTO :attribute_one,:attribute_two FROM DynamicSQLTestEnt WHERE attribute_one=:attribute_one; The method requires the type of the objects contained in the list to be defined. The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the SQL statement should also be defined, along with boolean indicators detailing if auditing should be performed for the SQL statement and whether an informational is required if readmulti maximum is reached, the maximum number of records to be returned by this readmulti operation also the handcrafted SQL string. DynamicDataAccess.executeNs(Class, Object, boolean, String) should be used to execute a SQL statement with a singleton result.

Type Parameters:
T - Details Struct Type
Parameters:
dtlsClass - The type of the objects to be contained in the returned list.
key - The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the dynamicSQL statement. null should be passed in if a key is not to be used.
performAuditing - Whether the database updates done by this operation should be recorded on an audit trail.
requireInformational - Indicator as to whether an informational is required when the readmulti maximum is reached. If the requireInformational is set false and readmulti maximum is reached then a readmulti-max message gets logged and all entries are returned to the user. If the requireInformational is set to true and readmulti maximum is reached then an InformationalMessage can be added to the current transactions Informational-Manager, for handling in the Application's Facade layer. In this case only the specified readmulti-max number of entries will be returned to the user.
readMultiMax - The maximum number of records to be returned by this readmulti operation.
dynamicSQL - A valid SQL statement to be executed against the database.
Returns:
The CuramValueList populated with the results of the dynamic data access SQL as a list of details objects, the type of which are specified as an input parameter. The size of the list depends on the specified requireInformational indicator and readMultiMax settings.
Throws:
AppException - If the provided dynamicSQL is invalid.
InformationalException - Generic exception signature.

validateNsMulti

public static <T> CuramValueList<T> validateNsMulti(java.lang.Class<T> dtlsClass,
                                                    java.lang.Object key,
                                                    boolean performAuditing,
                                                    boolean requireInformational,
                                                    int readMultiMax,
                                                    java.lang.String dynamicSQL)
                                         throws AppException,
                                                OtherDatabaseException,
                                                InformationalException
Validates an SQL query statement via execution and rollback allowing for multiple results that are dependent on the specified requireInformational boolean and readMultiMax value. The SQL statement result is returned as a CuramValueList populated with the results of the dynamic data access SQL as a list of details objects, the type of which are specified as an input parameter. This method does not commit any changes on to the database. The SQL should take the same form as handcrafted SQL in the model. For example: SELECT attribute_one, attribute_two INTO :attribute_one,:attribute_two FROM DynamicSQLTestEnt WHERE attribute_one=:attribute_one; The method requires the type of the objects contained in the list to be defined. The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the SQL statement should also be defined, along with a boolean indicator detailing if auditing should be performed for the SQL statement, and the handcrafted SQL string.

Type Parameters:
T - Details Struct Type
Parameters:
dtlsClass - The type of the objects to be contained in the returned list.
key - The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the dynamicSQL statement. null should be passed in if a key is not to be used.
performAuditing - Whether the database updates done by this operation should be recorded on an audit trail.
requireInformational - Indicator as to whether an informational is required when the readmulti maximum is reached. If the requireInformational is set false and readmulti maximum is reached then a readmulti-max message gets logged and all entries are returned to the user. If the requireInformational is set to true and readmulti maximum is reached then an InformationalMessage can be added to the current transactions Informational-Manager, for handling in the Application's Facade layer. In this case only the specified readmulti-max number of entries will be returned to the user.
readMultiMax - The maximum number of records to be returned by this readmulti operation.
dynamicSQL - A valid SQL statement to be executed against the database.
Returns:
The CuramValueList populated with the results of the dynamic data access SQL as a list of details objects, the type of which are specified as an input parameter. The size of the list depends on the specified requireInformational indicator and readMultiMax settings.
Throws:
AppException - If the provided dynamicSQL is not syntactically correct.
InformationalException - Generic exception signature.
OtherDatabaseException - If the provided dynamicSQL throws any database exception.

validateNsMulti

public static <T> CuramValueList<T> validateNsMulti(java.lang.Class<T> dtlsClass,
                                                    java.lang.Object key,
                                                    boolean performAuditing,
                                                    java.lang.String dynamicSQL)
                                         throws AppException,
                                                OtherDatabaseException,
                                                InformationalException
Validates an SQL query statement via execution and rollback allowing for multiple results. The SQL statement result is returned as a CuramValueList populated with the results of the dynamic data access SQL as a list of details objects, the type of which are specified as an input parameter. This method does not commit any changes on to the database. The SQL should take the same form as handcrafted SQL in the model. For example: SELECT attribute_one, attribute_two INTO :attribute_one,:attribute_two FROM DynamicSQLTestEnt WHERE attribute_one=:attribute_one; The method requires the type of the objects contained in the list to be defined. The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the SQL statement should also be defined, along with a boolean indicator detailing if auditing should be performed for the SQL statement, and the handcrafted SQL string.

Type Parameters:
T - Details Struct Type
Parameters:
dtlsClass - The type of the objects to be contained in the returned list.
key - The class of the argument that will be passed to make up the dynamicSQL statement. null should be passed in if a key is not to be used.
performAuditing - Whether the database updates done by this operation should be recorded on an audit trail.
dynamicSQL - A valid SQL statement to be executed against the database.
Returns:
The CuramValueList populated with the results of the dynamic data access SQL as a list of details objects, the type of which are specified as an input parameter. The list contains all the entries and not only the curam.db.readmultimax number of records. If the readmulti maximum is reached then a readmulti-max message gets logged.
Throws:
AppException - If the provided dynamicSQL is not syntactically correct.
InformationalException - Generic exception signature.
OtherDatabaseException - If the provided dynamicSQL throws any database exception.
